choices.D: Vulnerability scanners, such as Nessus and OpenVAS, should never be used on a production network for any reason.
choices.B: Attackers use vulnerability scanners such as Nessus and OpenVAS to locate vulnerabilities in potential target hosts.
choices.C: Vulnerability scanners, such as Nessus and OpenVAS, are safe to experiment with on a production network environment.
choices.A: Security engineers that need to locate vulnerabilities in a managed environment commonly use vulnerability scanners, such as Nessus and OpenVAS.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

The virtual address space for a process is the set of virtual addresses that the process can use.

choices.A: actual physical location of an object in memory
choices.B: set of virtual memory addresses that it can use
choices.C: set of pages that are currently resident in physical memory
choices.D: system-level memory protection feature that is built into the operating system

questions.question_text: Which definition of the virtual address space for a Windows process is true?
Which statement about the difference between a denial-of-service attack and a distributed denial-of service attack is true?

discussion.content: LoL ... C and D are the same (good) answers, but a single letter !

choices.D: Dos attacks are launched from one host, and DDOS attacks are lunched from multiple hosts.
choices.C: Dos attacks are lunched from one host, and DDOS attacks are lunched from multiple hosts
choices.A: DDos attacks are lunched from one host, and DOS attacks are lunched from multiple hosts
choices.E: Dos attacks and DDOS attacks have no differences?
choices.B: Dos attacks only use flooding to compromise a network, and DDOS attacks m=only use other methods?
The TFTP server has an incorrect IP address.
choices.D: The TFTP server has an incorrect subnet mask.
choices.C: The network administrator computer has an incorrect IP address.
choices.A: The TFTP server cannot obtain an address from a DHCP Server

discussion.content: It's an APIPA address since it's in the 169.254.0.0/16 range. This means the server is configured to use DHCP but failed to get an IP address from the DHCP server.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A TFTP server has recently been installed in the Atlanta office. The network administrator is located in the NY office and has attempted to make a connection to the TFTP server. They are unable to backup the configuration file and Cisco IOS of the NY router to the TFTP server. Which cause of this problem is true?
Which two of the following pins are usually monitored by a network tap? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
I don't understand why B ? I should have said A ...
OK for D.

choices.B: Tx pin on the inbound traffic
choices.A: Rx pin on the inbound traffic
choices.C: Rx pin on the outbound traffic
choices.D: Tx pin on the outbound traffic
choices.E: Both Rx and Tx pins; inbound or outbound traffic flows do not apply.
